se.cbb.jprime.mcmc

Class HillClimbingAcceptor

  • java.lang.Object
    • se.cbb.jprime.mcmc.HillClimbingAcceptor
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    InfoProvider, ProposalAcceptor

    public class HillClimbingAcceptor
extends java.lang.Object
implements ProposalAcceptor
    Hill-climbing proposal acceptor. Only accepts a proposed state x' which has higher likelihood than the old state x.
    Author:
    Joel Sj√∂strand.

      double getPrecision()
      Returns the precision p such that a new state k' is deemed an improvement over old state k if likelihood(k')>p*likelihood(k).

    • Method Detail

      • acceptProposedState

        public boolean acceptProposedState(LogDouble proposedStateLikelihood,
                          LogDouble oldStateLikelihood,
                          java.util.List<Proposal> proposals)
                            throws RunAbortedException
        Returns true if a proposed state x' has a higher likelihood than the old state x. Does not require any proposal information nor a pseudo-random number generator. If the optimum is deemed to have been reached, a RunAbortedException is thrown.
        Specified by:
        acceptProposedState in interface ProposalAcceptor
        Parameters:
        proposedStateLikelihood - the likelihood P(x').
        oldStateLikelihood - the likelihood P(x).
        proposals - details the proposals made for going from x to x'. May be null.
        Returns:
        true if suggested state accepted; false if rejected.
        Throws:
        RunAbortedException

      • setPrecision

        public void setPrecision(double p)
        Sets the precision p such that a new state k' is deemed an improvement over old state k if likelihood(k')>p*likelihood(k).
        Parameters:

      • getPrecision

        public double getPrecision()
        Returns the precision p such that a new state k' is deemed an improvement over old state k if likelihood(k')>p*likelihood(k).
        Returns:
        the precision.
